Aiyaaah!

It's true, I converted and older version of the story into pdf (I=
 use 
pdfonline---very cool free service).  I use a mac at one of my jobs, =

borrowe=
d laptop so usually I have to keep straight in my mind the 
versions of doc=
uments I upload and overwrite.

SO today, I spent....5 hours going through =

it (T_T) http://1happyturtle.com/SilapaJarun/ONOS=
UZUE.pdf

Thanks Hirotada Tokugawa for informing me that it was full of 
sp=
elling errors (that's how I knew I converted the wrong draft) and 
probably=

Anyways I t=
hink that people who want to learn about the Meiji era 
should give the sto=
ry a chance, especially the last chapter will 
cover an important death (no=
t really popularized in manga or pop-
culture yet) and a very key developme=
nt of the era.

Footnotes galor all over the place, however there are tons =
of details 
which are accurate but I did not footnote, because it would be =

annoying to see footnote number 105 and then have to read an 
explanation =
at the bottom of the page.

I forced one friend to read the story and she f=
inished it in five 
days and her frank review was the story was atleast "st=
range".

Again you can support SHQ by paypaling $$ to shinsengumihq@yahoo.c=
om
or you can donate money to me at silapajarun@... 

I hope e=
veryone likes my version of Fujita Goro (I purposefully 
altered his name t=
o Fujita Gorou, just as I tweaked the names of many 
historical figures in =
the story).

Please review and email me---I'll even take one word reviews.
